NAME: Bowmore - Devil's Cask - Batch III - Double the Devil
DESCRIPTION: The third and final appearance of The Devil's Casks from Bowmore.  Deemed ' Double the Devil' Batch 3 combines the features of the previous two releases. Matured in both Pedro Ximénez and oloroso sherry casks.

NAME: Dalmore - Distillery Exclusive 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon Finish 2007
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in 2019, this yearly release from the distillery has been finished in Cabernet Sauvignon casks.
Distilled in 2007 it's said to have a palate resembling caramelised orange, rich napoleon cake and treacle. 
Bottled at cask strength.
The bottle has been signed by Richard Patterson.

NAME: Bimber - Oloroso Cask - Small Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 950 bottles in the Bimber Oloroso Sherry Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels then finished in casks that previously held Spanish Oloroso Sherry to finish.
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled on 3rd June 2020.
 
Bottle 413.

NAME: Caperdonich - 21 Year Old Peated - Distillery Reserve 1996
DESCRIPTION: The Chivas ‘Distillery Reserve Collection’ is a showcase of cask strength expressions.  This particular single malt whisky was distilled on the 7th October 1996 then bottled on 6th August 2018 from a single second fill barrel.

NAME: Ardbeg - 10 Year Old Still Young 1998-2008 2nd Release
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1998, Ardbeg Still Young was released in 2008. 
It is part of a series called the ‘path to peaty maturity’ of which this is the second release.

NAME: Jura - 21 Year Old - Private Estate
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Isle of Jura Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION: This 21 year old is a private estate bottling which was distilled in 1984 to commemorate the famous novel written on the island.

NAME: Laphroaig - 15 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A smart old bottle of Laphroaig, bottled in the mid to late 1990s, after the award of the Royal Warrant in 1994. Laphroaig 15 Year Old is smoother than the robust 10-year-old.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - Moine Fèis Ìle 2009 Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled to celebrate Feis in 2019, this is a rather rare bottle of Bunnahabhain. It was finished in Oloroso sherry butts for 3 months.
Only 642 bottles were produced for the festival.
This lot comes with a special wheel keyring and is number 614.

NAME: Laphroaig - 15 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A smart old bottle of Laphroaig, bottled in the mid to late 1990s, after the award of the Royal Warrant in 1994. Laphroaig 15 Year Old is smoother than the robust 10-year-old.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2004 PX - Coterie
DESCRIPTION: This  Bunnahabhain expression was released exclusively for the Coterie Club members. It was distilled in 2004 and matured for 15 years then finished in Pedro Ximenez sherry casks  for 6 years.  This bottle was hand-filled at the distillery.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #005
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is from batch 005, original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig. This release was bottled at 57.2% in February 2013.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 14 Year Old (2005) Burgundy Finish
DESCRIPTION:
This Bunnahabhain was distilled in late 2005 and was matured in refill whisky hogsheads before being transferred Burgundy wine casks for the rest of the maturation period. This is one of 600 bottles.
This is bottle number 093.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.3
DESCRIPTION:
The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

NAME: Lagavulin - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2017
DESCRIPTION: This was Lagavulin’s 2017 Fèis Ìle bottling. It is a 16-year old Islay, Moscatel Cask Wood double matured, limited to 6000 individually numbered bottles.  Bottled in 2017 at natural cask strength for the annual Islay whisky festival in May.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.3
DESCRIPTION:
The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

NAME: Macallan - 10 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A 10 year old single malt from The Macallan Distillery.  It has been exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.3
DESCRIPTION:
The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

NAME: Laphroaig - 15 Year Old Friends of Laphroaig 90s
DESCRIPTION:
A smart old bottle of Laphroaig, bottled to celebrate the great following that this Islay distillery has. 
If you didn't already know you too can own a small part of the land on Islay...find out more when this bottle becomes your next purchase...

NAME: Macallan - Estate Reserve - 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Estate Reserve 2019 forms part of The 1824 Collection. It is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.
All of the whisky used was grown locally on the Macallan estate.  The whisky is distilled just once a year, over the course of a single week. The single malt was then matured exclusively in sherry seasoned butts and hogsheads.

NAME: Ardbeg - Supernova - 2019 Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: Excluisvley released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask No. 1 - 2019
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Rare Cask Batch No.1, 2018 release introduced a new look for Rare Cask which has been rebranded and revised.  It is an attempt by Macallan to give greater insight into their whisky making process.  This first batch was one of three batches to be released in 2018, with further batches planned for subsequent years. Each limited release batch represents the volume of only 50 oak sherry butts.

NAME: Inchgower -13 Year Old - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 13 year old is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases. The bottles were released exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo. Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength. 
This release was bottled in 2007 at 58.9%.
This is bottle number 0218.

NAME: Balvenie - 14 Year Old Golden Cask
DESCRIPTION: Distilled and bottled in Speyside at Balvenie, this dram has been matured beautifully and then finished Caribbean rum casks. It was released in 2010 as part of the travel series for Balvenie and has more recently in 2012 been repackaged as the much loved Caribbean Cask.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #6220 - Velier
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Velier.  Distilled in 2004, this single malt was matured for 13 years in Refill Butt #6220 at the cask strength of 62.5% ABV.  With only 534 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Springbank - 10 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Still part of the core range down in Campletown.
The distillery has been making somewhat of a come back lately with collectors scrambling to get their hands on some of their sublime malts. 
Springbank 10...lovely, just lovely.

NAME: Glenfarclas - 2009 #1446 Distillery Exclusive 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This is a distillery exclusive release from Glenfarclas.  This 2009 vintage single malt was chosen by the team at the very heart of the whisky making process, the Stillmen!
The 3 gents supposedly had a great time away from the day job choosing this release. It is a first-fill Oloroso Sherry cask #1446 that produced 658 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle 591.

NAME: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - Single Cask #596 - Absalon - Founders Series Edition 2
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Absalon.  This is edition 2 in The Founders Series. Distilled in 2007, this single malt was matured for 10 years in European Oak Sherry Hogshead #596 at the cask strength of 63.6% ABV.  With only 300 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #6712 - The bishop Arms
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for The Bishop Arms, which is a pub in Sweden.  This 'William the Old' edition was distilled in 2004, and matured for 12 years in European Oak Sherry Butt #6712 and bottled at the cask strength of 63.1% ABV.  With only 492 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Glenallachie - 13 Year Old 2006 Single Cask #6601 - Spirit of Speyside 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask release was specially selected for the 2020 Spirit of Speyside festival.  Distilled on the 19th of June 2006 and has been aged 13 years in a single PX Hogshead  #6601. 
This is one of 332 bottles.
This is bottle number 276.

NAME: Springbank - 10 Year Old - Local Barley 2009
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled and bottled from barley grown on the Kintyre Peninsula within just a few miles of Springbank distillery itself.
This barely is still malted on their own malt floors using traditional techniques. Bottling takes place on-site making it 100% Campbellton single malt.
Distilled July 2009.
Bottled in October 2019.
9000 Bottles produced.

NAME: Ardbeg - Perpetuum - Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

NAME: Laphroiag - 18 Year Old 2004 - Old Particular - Queen of the Hebrides
DESCRIPTION: Only 665 bottles of this 1998 vintage single malt from Laphroaig Distillery were charged from a single refill butt by Douglas Laing, for their Old Particular Range. This bottling is 'The Queen of the Hebrides'

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Rare Cask is comprised of 16 different sherry-cask styles, the majority of which are first fill.  Rich and complex with notes of dark honey and dried fruit, this bridges the gap between The 1824 Series and The 1824 Collection.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1986 Valinch - Continuation of the Celebration
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling from Bruichladdich was distilled in 1986 and bottled from a single Oloroso Cask #700. It was originally only available at Bruichladdich Distillery, released in continuation of the re-opening of Bruichladdich Distillery.  This is one of 1200 bottles. This is a 50cl bottling.
 
 
This is bottle number 555.

NAME: Glenfiddich - Winter Storm #3
DESCRIPTION: This is the third release in Glenfiddich's Experimental Series by Malt Master Brian Kinsman and the first to be a limited batch release.  This 21 year old Glenfiddich has been finished in an ice wine cask from Peller Estate in Niagra, Canada.

NAME: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.

NAME: Macallan - Classic Cut - 2017
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Classic Cut - 2017 edition is the first release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 58.4%.  This is a 75cl bottling.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

NAME: Dufftown - 14 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
From The Manager's Dram range (a series of releases for Diageo staff members featuring whiskies picked out by distillery managers) comes a 14 year old single malt from Dufftown. The label features a golden salmon jumping over a picture of the distillery.
Bottle 796.

NAME: Blair Athol - 18 Year Old - Bicentennial Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This lot is a 18 year old bottling is to celebrate 200 years of malt whisky distilling at Blair Athol Distillery. This special cask strength limited edition bottling has been produced as a tribute to the staff, past and present.

NAME: Tormore - 10 Year Old 1980s
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled and bottled in Speyside, this is an early to mid-1980s bottling of Tormore that has been matured 10 years.
At the time of bottling, this distillery was owned by the Long John distilleries Ltd. The site of the distillery is located beside the Achvochkie burn was chosen for the quality and purity of the water.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

NAME: Glenfarclas - 14 Years Old 2005 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
A suspended summer release of a 14-year-old distillery exclusive that has been bottled for The Spirit of Speyside 2020. It was distilled in 2005 and matured in an Oloroso Sherry butt before being bottled at cask strength 58.2% .
Cask #2855 yielded 650 bottles and also comes with the distinctive Glenfarclas wooden case.

NAME: Highland Park - 18 Year Old Single Cask #2865 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An Orkney favourite in this Highland Park single cask which has been matured for 18 years in American Oak Butt #2865..
606 bottles were produced from this cask.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old 2003 Single Cask  #5878 Braunstein & Friends
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling was limited to 648 bottles and aged for 12 years in a single cask.
Highland Park bottled cask #5878 especially for Braunstein & Friends in 2016.
It was a 1st fill European sherry butt and was distilled back in 2003.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

NAME: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label - Tom Dixon Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition of the popular Johnnie Walker Blue Label is a collaboration between Master Blender, Jim Beveridge, and British designer, Tom Dixon OBE.
Inspired by the rarity, craft and heritage of Scotch whisky, the copper accents are characteristic of Dixon's designs and are evocative of the copper pot stills used in distillation.
Blue Label is the pinnacle of the Johnnie Walker range, with just one in ten thousand casks of the rarest whiskies selected by Beveridge to craft this unrivalled masterpiece.

NAME: Bladnoch - 10 Year Old Flora and Fauna (Wooden Box)
DESCRIPTION:
In the 1990's Diageo created the Flora and Fauna series. Some bottles are, as usual, harder to come by than others. As it only operated from 1974 until 1993 there is only a very small number of bottlings of their spirit available.
This distillery is the most southerly in Scotland and was founded in the early 1800s. Its Lowland nature produces the most amazing whisky with delicate fruity and lemony aromas. 
Aged 10 years.

NAME: Glenallachie - 13 Year Old 2006 Single Cask #6601 - Spirit of Speyside 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask release was specially selected for the 2020 Spirit of Speyside festival.  Distilled on the 19th of June 2006 and has been aged 13 years in a single PX Hogshead  #6601. 
This is one of 332 bottles.

NAME: Ardbeg - 1998 Almost There 10 Year Old 2007
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in 2007, this bottling proceeds the "Very Young and Still Young".
The Almost There was thought to be the final release in the journey of the cask-strength Islay malts in 1998 before the Renaissance 10-year-old was finally released.

NAME: Highland Park - 23 Year Old 1981 First Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Direct wines, owners of Laithwaites wines are an independent bottler and they release whiskies under the 'first cask' label. The series of single cask whiskies are all bottled at 46% ABV from a variety of distilleries (some of which are unidentified), for its customers to order by the mixed case.
Distilled on the 17th of September, this is a 23 year old single malt from Highland Park. 
Cask #6039. 
Bottle 129.

NAME: Port Charlotte - 11 Year Old - 2003 Cask Exploration #02
DESCRIPTION: A Port Charlotte 2003 vintage matured for 11 years in Pessac-Leognan cask #637. Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 02 Gorag. One of 360 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.

NAME: Ardbeg - Perpetuum - Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

NAME: Cragganmore - 24 Year Old 1982 First Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Direct wines, owners of Laithwaites wines are an independent bottler and they release whiskies under the 'first cask' label. The series of single cask whiskies are all bottled at 46% ABV from a variety of distilleries (some of which are unidentified), for its customers to order by the mixed case.
Distilled and bottled in Speyside at the Cragganmore distillery, this dram is 24 years old. It was distilled on the 24th of June 1982. 
 
Bottle 210.

NAME: Highland Park - 17 Year Old - The Dark
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 2017, 'The Dark' is first in the Highland Park series that celebrates the seasons on the Isle of Orkney, where Highland Park is made. The Dark is a 17-year-old single malt that has been matured in sherry casks, giving it aromas of dried fruits, nuts and herbs combined with smoky peat to as a nod to the autumn and winter seasons of Orkney.  The Light followed in 2018 symbolising spring and summer. 
The Dark is a limited release 28,000.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #005
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is from batch 005, original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig. This release was bottled at 57.2% in February 2013.

NAME: Highland Park - 17 Year Old - The Light
DESCRIPTION: Highland Park 'The Light' is a 17 year old single malt inspired by spring and summer on Orkney, released in 2018.  It is the follow up to the Highland Park 2017 release in the series - 'The Dark'.  The Light is a fresh and zesty Highland Park expression, that has been matured in refill American oak casks giving it notes of pear, vanilla and soft spice.

NAME: Ardbeg - Perpetuum - Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

NAME: Ardbeg - 10 Year Old Still Young 1998-2008 2nd Release
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1998, Ardbeg Still Young was released in 2008. 
It is part of a series called the ‘path to peaty maturity’ of which this is the second release.

NAME: Lagavulin - Islay Jazz Festival 2017
DESCRIPTION:
The 2017 Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival expression was matured in a combination of refill American oak hogsheads and first-fill American oak barrels.  It’s described as a sweet and typically peaty expression, with ‘hints of almonds, brazil nuts, pears and smoked ham’.
This is a limited edition release of just 6000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 2902.

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: Clynelish - 14 Year Old - Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION:
This is a rare bottling of Clynelish, which is part of the Flora and Fauna series.  This bottling has now discontinued.
Because of its popularity, it ended up having a spin-off for its own line of single malt whisky.

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: Caol Ila  - 20 Year Old 1996 Old Particular
DESCRIPTION:
Only 316 bottles of this single malt scotch whisky have been produced from the Caol Ila distillery, Islay.
Distilled in September 1996 this cask strength expression was aged for 20 years before being bottled by the family-owned firm Douglas Laing.

NAME: Highland Park - 16 Year Old 2001 Single Cask #386 Vintersolhverv
DESCRIPTION:
Only 594 bottles were produced from this vintage cask which is from Highland Parks single cask series. 
Distilled in 2001 and matured for 16 years before being bottled from cask #386, which was a European Sherry Oak Butt.
Vintersolhverv - "The Swedish winter solstice"

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old Diamond Jubilee
DESCRIPTION:
The 18 year old expression was released in 2009 and took over from the much loved 15 year old. 
However, this is not just any 18 year old...
It was released in 2018 summer season and only 3000 were made. It has been decorated and designed to celebrate the Queen's Diamond Jubilee.
On a side note, £3000 was donated from the sale of this bottle to Queen Elizabeth Scholarship Trust by Jim Beam.

NAME: Clynelish - 1995 20 Year Old - Signatory Vintage
DESCRIPTION:
Signatory's bottling of Clynelish 1995 20 Year Old is a beautiful piece. Becoming more and more collectable over the years this specific bottle was distilled on 26th September 1995 and bottled on 18th August 2016.
The decanter collection is certainly for the esteemed collectors.
840 came from cask #8691.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 20 Year Old 1994 Cadenhead's
DESCRIPTION:
Bunnahabhain was founded in 1881 and takes the water from the river Margadale. This specific bottling was from a Bourbon Hogshead that was distilled in 1994 and bottled in 2015. 
Said to have a chewy oily finish...lovely!

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ballykilcavan 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Ballykilcavan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1990 Valinch 'Ghost Ship'
DESCRIPTION:
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process. The term Valinch is a piece of old whisky terminology that comes from the Spanish & French. It is the word for a pipette that takes the samples from a cask. These bottlings were introduced to the public after the distillery was purchased in 2001 by Murray McDavid.
Released for Feis 2007, this single malt was distilled in 1990. This bottling is named after a "phantom" oil tanker at the pier near Bruichladdich. The story goes such that the ship couldn't dock due to it's a flawed design. As you can imagine it has been a legend ever since. 
The cask was a Bourbon Squat #525. Only 350 bottles were produced.
This is bottle No 9.

NAME: Glenkinchie - 15 Year Old - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 15 Year Old Glenkinchie is part of the Manager’s Dram Series, which were available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo. These whiskies were specially selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
This is a numbered bottle.
This is bottle number 0523.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #3600 - Texas
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Texas.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in refill sherry butt #3600 and was bottled at the cask strength of 62.7% ABV.  With only 600 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ballykilcavan 1.2
DESCRIPTION:
Ballykilcavan: Edition 1.2 – the second release, uses barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis west of the Barrow in Co. Laois in the barley heartlands, where his fertile fields are sheltered by ancient woodland.
Bottled at 50% ABV without colouring, chill-filtration or any additives.

NAME: Talisker - 8 Year Old 2009 Cask Strength Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled on the beautiful Island of Skye on the west coast of Scotland in 2009. This limited release was distilled in 2009 and matured in a first fill Ex-bourbon American Oak cask. 
This distillery is now part of Diageo's portfolio.

NAME: Arran - 20 Year Old - The Explorers Series - Brodick Bay - Vol.1
DESCRIPTION:
'Brodick Bay' is Volume 1 in The Aaron Malt 'Explorer Series' which is a collection of limited edition expressions from the Arran Distillery. Each edition celebrates the outstanding scenic beauty and diversity of nature on the Isle of Arran.
This 20 year old single malt has been matured in both Bourbon Barrels and Sherry Hogsheads before being finished in Oloroso Sherry Butts sourced directly from Bodegas Tradicion in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain.
The presentation tin and the bottle label features a beautiful view from the foothills south of Brodick Bay.  This is one of 9000 bottles.

NAME: Tamdhu - 10 Year Old  - 1980s
DESCRIPTION: Tamdhu 10 Year Old is a 75cl bottling which is from the 1980s.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask Series Germany #6353
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 13 Year Old is part of the single cask series by the Island Distillery.
Matured in a first fill European Sherry Hogshead and bottled in 2016.
Distilled in 2002 this release was limited to 318 bottles exclusively produced for GERMANY.

NAME: Glendullan - 12 Year Old 1970s
DESCRIPTION:
An official 1970s bottling of 12 year old Glendullan from the Speyside distillery. This bottling is 
This is an old official bottling from the 1970s, prior to Diageo's purchase of the distillery.

NAME: Wolfburn - Kaunaz - Kylver Series - 6th Release
DESCRIPTION:
This is the 2020 release from the sought after Wolfburn Kylver range which is the sixth in the series. Kaunaz was drawn from 2014 vintage first-fill bourbon barrels and bottled at 50% ABV. 
The Kylver series follows the Viking runic alphabet engraved on a large stone excavated in Gotland (Sweden) in 1903.  
Wolfburn Distillery is located in Thurso, making it the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland.  Based around a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn reopened in 2013.

NAME: Bowmore - Devil's Cask - Batch III - Double the Devil
DESCRIPTION: The third and final appearance of The Devil's Casks from Bowmore.  Deemed ' Double the Devil' Batch 3 combines the features of the previous two releases. Matured in both Pedro Ximénez and oloroso sherry casks.

NAME: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.

NAME: Tamdhu - 10 Year Old  - 1980's
DESCRIPTION:
Tamdhu 10 Year Old is a 75cl bottling which is from the 1980's.
General conditon of this lot including the sticker on the exterior of the box and small tear to lid.

NAME: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask Series Viking Soul #2544
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
Highland Park 14 Year Old is part of the single cask series by the Island Distillery.
Distilled on 2002, matured in a first fill European sherry puncheon and bottled in 2016 at the natural cask strength of 59.9%.
This is one of just 648 bottles exclusively produced for people with Viking Soul.

NAME: Macallan - Aera
DESCRIPTION: Released in 2018 for the Taiwanese market, Macallan Aera was matured in seasoned sherry casks and features lots of dried fruit flavours on the palate.  It was bottled at 40% ABV and as the label says, it was made with some thoughtfulness in mind.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1990 Valinch 'The Purest Whisky in Scotland'
DESCRIPTION:
A 1990 vintage cask strength valinch in celebrating three Bruichladdich bottlings being blind-tasted and statistically analysed and found to zero ratings for undesirable impurities or off-flavours of any kind - the only three to do so of 350 whiskies tasted. 
Distilled on 16th February 1990 and matured in refill bourbon cask #710 and bottled at  55.5%.
This is one of 350 50cl bottlings.
This is bottle number 016.

NAME: Islay Pillaged - 10 Year Old Blend 2003
DESCRIPTION:
10 Year Old whiskies from Islay distilleries blended together and bottled in 2003.
This was in aid of Cancer Research and the Islay Life Boat.
Making this even more special each malt had been collected by a team member of the boat which rowed around Islay in the process.
42 miles were covered in the process.

NAME: Bruichladdich - Valinch  Vatican - Warehouse 12 (50cl)
DESCRIPTION:
'Valinch' is an old whisky term, derived from Spanish & French for a pipettte used for drawing cask samples.  This is a limited edition, distillery exclusive bottling of Bruichladdich, which was hand filled on the day of their visit.  This single malt was distilled 11th of June 1991 and then bottled from single bourbon cask No.21 at 53.3% ABV.
This is one of just 430 bottles.
Bottle number 7.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1989 Valinch 'The Queens Award'
DESCRIPTION:
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process. The term Valinch is an piece of old whisky terminology that comes from the Spanish & French. It is the word for a pipette that takes the samples from a cask.
Bottled to celebrate the Queen's award, this dram was distilled on April 12th 1989 before being filled into a refil Sherry #944. Only 344 bottles were produced and it was bottled 29th of May 2005.
This is bottle 16.

NAME: Bruichladdich - The Palace Partnership
DESCRIPTION:
All of these bottles in the valinch series are hand bottled on Islay. This bottling was exclusive the visitors of the distillery and bottled at cask strength. 
This Palace partnership bottling comes from a bourbon cask and celebrates the Queens award in 2005. 
This is one of 420 bottles.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1988 Valinch 'The Mayor of Islay'
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1988, this Bruichladdich was matured in a single sherry cask #1184. Bottled in honour of the Mayor of Islay, this is part of the 50cl 'Valinch' series.
The bottle when first released was only available to purchase from the distillery. However, now as you can see, you have the chance to buy it with The Grand Whisky Auction. 
Only 375 bottles were produced.
Bottle 28.

NAME: Pillage Trilogy 2005 - 12 Year Old - Blended Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Pillaged from each of the operating Islay distilleries and from Bushmills in Northern Ireland and just across the water on Jura.
The masters behind this bend rowed between each of the distilleries in order to collect the whisky which was eventually created for all proceeds to be donated to charitable causes.

NAME: Macallan - Classic Cut - 2017
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Classic Cut - 2017 edition is the first release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 58.4%.  This is a 75cl bottling.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

NAME: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.
Bottle 2853.

NAME: Bruichladdich - Babe 1990 Valinch
DESCRIPTION:
Famous for its Whisky and now its Gin this is an early bottling that celebrates the Middle White Pig Society visit to the distillery on Islay. 
The distillery now instantly recognisable due to its unique colour is owned by Rémy Cointreau. 
This is from a refill Sherry Butt.
Distilled on 5th Sept 1990 and bottled on 5/12/2003 from Cask number 3666.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #3374 - Loch Fyne Whiskies
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Loch Fyne Whiskies.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 15 years in refill butt #3374 at the cask strength of 58.4% ABV.  With only 584 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1990 Valinch - Continuation of the Celebration
DESCRIPTION:
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process. The term Valinch is a piece of old whisky terminology that comes from the Spanish & French. It is the word for a pipette that takes the samples from a cask. These bottlings were introduced to the public after the distillery was purchased in 2001 by Murray McDavid.
This bottling from Bruichladdich was distilled in 1990 and bottled from a single refill sherry #988. It was originally only available at Bruichladdich Distillery, released in continuation of the re-opening of Bruichladdich Distillery.  This is one of 500 bottles. This is a 50cl bottling.
 
 
Bottle number 7.

NAME: Strathmill - 15 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 15 year old single malt from the Strathmill Distillery is part of The Manager's Dram series exclusively for Diageo employees (formerly United Distillers).  It was bottled at 53.5%. 
The Diageo Managers Dram bottlings, each selected by distillery managers, are bottled at natural cask strength.
This is bottle number 1123.

NAME: Clynelish - 14 Year Old - Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION:
This is a rare bottling of Clynelish, which is part of the Flora and Fauna series.  This bottling has now discontinued.
Because of its popularity, it ended up having a spin-off for its own line of single malt whisky.

NAME: Arran - 20 Year Old - The Explorers Series - Brodick Bay - Vol.1
DESCRIPTION:
'Brodick Bay' is Volume 1 in The Aaron Malt 'Explorer Series' which is a collection of limited edition expressions from the Arran Distillery. Each edition celebrates the outstanding scenic beauty and diversity of nature on the Isle of Arran.
This 20 year old single malt has been matured in both Bourbon Barrels and Sherry Hogsheads before being finished in Oloroso Sherry Butts sourced directly from Bodegas Tradicion in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain.
The presentation tin and the bottle label features a beautiful view from the foothills south of Brodick Bay.  This is one of 9000 bottles.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2007 Port Pipe - Limited Release
DESCRIPTION:
This Bunnahabhain limited release was distilled in 2007 and was aged in Warehouse 8 for 11 years.  Initially matured in whisky refill hogshead casks and then filled into port pipes in 2016 for a final 2 years of maturation. It was bottled at 55.3% ABV.  This is one of 1578 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 815.

NAME: Macallan - 10 Year Old - Sherry Oak
DESCRIPTION: Matured exclusively in oak sherry casks from Jerez in Spain.  This age statement was discontinued by Macallan in 2013.

NAME: Port Dundas - 25 Year (1991) - Creative Whisky Co.
DESCRIPTION: Matured in a refill hogshead in the single grain distillery in Glasgow, Port Dundas. It was distilled in March 1991 matured in hogshead 50412 and bottled 25 years later at 55.6% by The Creative Whisky Co.

NAME: Ardbeg - Auriverdes
DESCRIPTION: This special edition Ardbeg single malt was released on Ardbeg Day 2014. during Feis Ile.  Auri(Gold) verdes (Green) it refers to the golden whisky and the iconic Ardbeg green bottle of Ardbeg whisky.  It is said to be a dram of two halves -  the whisky uses toasted cask lids to create Mocha Coffee flavours that team up with creamy vanilla.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Feis Ile 2008
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This bottling was created to celebrate the 2008 Feis Ile.

NAME: Highland Park - Hobbister
DESCRIPTION:
Hobbister is the first release in the Highland Park Keystone Series – a collection of special bottlings that highlight our five Keystones of production which combine to make Highland Park stand apart from other Single Malts.
The special edition takes its name from a peat moor.  This environment creates a unique aromatic peat consisting of decaying heather and plants rather than the trees that characterise the peat used by other distilleries.
A release of 1,200 bottles.

NAME: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.
This is bottle number 1334.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blasda (Limited Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in 2008, Ardbeg Blasda is a lesser-peated version of many people's favourite Islay malt, being just 8ppm in bottle (as opposed to the standard 10yo's 23ppm).  It is described as 'a lighter taste of Islay.' It has hints of sweets and chocolates for a pleasant accompaniment to the mild characteristic Ardbeg peaty tones. After all, 'Blasda' in Gaelic means 'sweet and delicious.'

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2010 - Amontillado Finish - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 6 years in classic bourbon barrels, after which the single malt was transferred to Amontillado sherry Hogsheads for another three years.  It was bottled at 56.9% and was released by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1658 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 101.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

NAME: Pillage Trilogy - 14 Year Old - Blended Malt 2007
DESCRIPTION:
Whisky was 'pillaged' from every Islay distilleries (not the closed ones) and Jura and finally Bushmills in Northern Ireland.
The last in the Trilogy series & bottled in March 2008. 
This charitable bottle has the participants row between each of the distilleries in order to collect the whisky.
All proceeds were donated from the sale of these bottles.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Feis Ile 2008
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This bottling was created to celebrate the 2008 Feis Ile.

NAME: Blanton's - Single Barrel Gold Edition #552
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's are famous for producing the first single barrel bourbon in the USA.
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
Drawn from a single barrel, number 552, which was stored on rick number 17. Each bottling is individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand.
Bottle 43.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Triple Cask 2018 (Fine Oak)
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old Macallan single malt was released in 2018 and sits is at the top of the Triple Cask range (which replaced the Fine Oak range).  The whisky was matured in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.  This expression boasts bountiful notes of vanilla, dried fruit and woody spice.

NAME: Laphroaig - 15 Year Old - 200th Anniversary Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This limited release 15-year-old Laphroaig single malt was bottled to commemorate Laphroigs 200th Anniversary.  To mark their bicentenary they brought back their 15-Year-Old for a limited edition release.  Laphroaig 15 Year Old was first released in the 1980s, but it was eventually replaced with the Laphroaig 18 Year Old.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Master Edition
DESCRIPTION: Released for the 2010 Feis Ile and sold exclusively from Laphroaig Distillery.  Cairdeas, meaning Friendship, is an annual limited edition release from Laphroaig Distillery. This bottling is a harmony of malt ranging from 11 to 19 years of age. It was specifically selected by Laphroaig Master Blender Robert Hicks in celebration of the 2010 Feis Ile and Friends of Laphroaig worldwide.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #007
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is from batch 007, original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour. This release was bottled at 56.3% in January 2015. It was the year Laphroaig celebrated 200 years of Laphroaig.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2003 - Amontillado Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 2019 distillery exclusive from Bunnahabhain Distillery. This Amontillado Cask Finish limited edition started life on the 20th of February 2003 in refill hogsheads before being transferred to Amontillado sherry hogsheads on the 26th of February 2016 where it spent two more years maturing in Bunnahabhain's coastal warehouses.
This is one of 1710 bottles.
This is bottle number 1364.

NAME: Bellevue - 19 Year Old  1998 The Duchess Single Cask Guadeloupe Rum
DESCRIPTION: This is a special rum and is one of only 303 bottles. It was bottled in 2017 Duchess Spirits from single cask #22. The bottling was originally distilled in 1998.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Master Edition
DESCRIPTION: Released for the 2010 Feis Ile and sold exclusively from Laphroaig Distillery.  Cairdeas, meaning Friendship, is an annual limited edition release from Laphroaig Distillery. This bottling is a harmony of malt ranging from 11 to 19 years of age. It was specifically selected by Laphroaig Master Blender Robert Hicks in celebration of the 2010 Feis Ile and Friends of Laphroaig worldwide.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Master Edition
DESCRIPTION: Released for the 2010 Feis Ile and sold exclusively from Laphroaig Distillery.  Cairdeas, meaning Friendship, is an annual limited edition release from Laphroaig Distillery. This bottling is a harmony of malt ranging from 11 to 19 years of age. It was specifically selected by Laphroaig Master Blender Robert Hicks in celebration of the 2010 Feis Ile and Friends of Laphroaig worldwide.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 18 Year Old - Hand Filled (Culag)
DESCRIPTION:
This Distillery Exclusive handful was drawn from a 'Culag' cask.  The single malt has been matured for 18 years, including a finish in a Cognac cask.
It was bottled by hand on the 24th of May 2019. This is one of only 190 bottles.
 
Bottle 15.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2010 - Amontillado Finish - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 6 years in classic bourbon barrels, after which the single malt was transferred to Amontillado sherry Hogsheads for another three years.  It was bottled at 56.9% and was released by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1658 bottles produced.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #3374 - Loch Fyne Whiskies
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Loch Fyne Whiskies.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 15 years in refill butt #3374 at the cask strength of 58.4% ABV.  With only 584 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Longmorn - 15 Year Old 2005 - North Star Spirits
DESCRIPTION: A rare single cask Longmorn 15-year-old from North Star Spirits, which has been drawn from Oloroso sherry butt. Bottled at huge 63.1% ABV in June 2020, this is one of only 550 bottles.  An all-round superb heavily-sherried Speyside single malt.

NAME: Balblair - 1991 Vintage 2018 3rd Release
DESCRIPTION:
One of the not only the Highland distilleries but all of Scotlands distilleries, Balblair is owned by Inverhouse. 
Moving with the times, Balblair has also changed from oil to gas to reduce its carbon footprint. 
This is, of course, the new packaging that has been redesigned and is part of the annual vintage series. It was distilled in 1991 and bottled in 2018. 
This is their 3rd release.

NAME: Macallan - Enigma
DESCRIPTION: Enigma is at the top end of Macallan's Quest Collection (released for the Travel Retail market).  The expression has been drawn exclusively from European oak Sherry seasons casks from one cooperage in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain.  The Macallan Enigma is a testament that every end has a new beginning, always venturing on the brink of a new discovery.

NAME: Bowmore - 18 Year Old 2001 - North Star
DESCRIPTION: This 2001 vintage 18-year-old limited edition Bowmore was bottled by North Star Spirits in June 2020.  Released as part of their 10th series of single casks. This is one of 190 bottles at 55.2% vol.

NAME: Port Charlotte - 16 year Old Heavily Peated Feis 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This super heavily peated malt is the oldest release in the series. It was distilled in 2003 and Bruoichladdich used only Scottish barely. Only 3000 bottles were produced at 55.8% Abv. 
Casks used -
Refill Hogshead - Then recasked to bourbon barrels in 2012.
Firstfill Bourbon Barrels - Then recasked into ex-Sauternes casks in 2013.
Ex Sherry / Ex Bourbon and Virgin Oak.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1994 Some Utter Fake
DESCRIPTION:
This special bottling was distilled on 30th September 1994 and matured in bourbon cask #40 then ACE'd (finished) in a Chenin Blanc cask, released in April 2008. This is one of 300 bottles.
007

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #6551 - San Diego
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for San Diego.  Distilled in 2004, this single malt was matured for 12 years in First Fill European Sherry Oak Butt #6551 at the cask strength of 65.6% ABV.  With only 294 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Benrinnes - 25 Year Old - Sherry Butt #2273 (Bladnoch Forum)
DESCRIPTION:
This 1984 vintage single cask Benrinnes was bottled specially for Bladnoch Distillery Forum from sherry butt #2273.  This is one of 611 bottles filled on the 19th August 2010 at the cask strength of 51%.
 
This is bottle number 329.

NAME: Lagavulin - 1999 Distillers Edition 2015
DESCRIPTION:
This Lagavulin Distillers Edition was distilled in 1999 before being bottled in 2015. This 16-year-old single malt whisky of the Classic Malts Selection was matured for up to 6 months in European Pedro Ximenez Sherry oak casks - these give the whisky more fruity and syrupy character.
Batch lgv.4/504.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Mortlach - 13 Year Old 2004 - Old Particular - Ace of Spades
DESCRIPTION: Only 521 bottles of this 2004 vintage single malt from Mortlach Distillery were bottled in 2017 from a Pedro Ximenez sherry-butt by Douglas Laing, for their Old Particular Range.

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: Arran - 21 Year Old Explorer Series Kildonan & Pladda Island Volume III
DESCRIPTION:
The isle of Arran is known for great whisky and equally stunning views. The explorers series are all limited editions of which this is the third release. Each release pays tribute to the stunning views that can be absorbed when visiting the island. 
Only 9000 bottles of the Kildonan & Pladda Island have been released. The dram within was matured in sherry butts and puncheons before being finished in Ruby Port casks.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Fire
DESCRIPTION: This stunning Highland Park 15 year old single malt follows the 'Ice' edition to complete this Highland Park two-part series. The 'Fire' edition celebrates Muspelheim, the glowing Norse fire realm of destruction.  The malt was matured in refill Port casks and bottled at 45.2% abv. It's presented in a cradle shaped like a mountain.

NAME: Highland Park - 17 Year Old - Ice
DESCRIPTION:
Following on from The Valhalla Collection, this limited edition Highland Park also comes with a cradle, which is shaped like a mountain as opposed to a longship.
Matured mostly in bourbon casks, this bottling was released in honour of the Ice Realm of Niflheim (hence the cut blue glass bottle). This land of perpetual ice and cold is home to the frozen river of Elivágar and the well of Hvergelmir! There are Nine Worlds in Norse mythology, but this two-part series is completed by Highland Park Fire Edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Fire
DESCRIPTION: This stunning Highland Park 15 year old single malt follows the 'Ice' edition to complete this Highland Park two-part series. The 'Fire' edition celebrates Muspelheim, the glowing Norse fire realm of destruction.  The malt was matured in refill Port casks and bottled at 45.2% abv. It's presented in a cradle shaped like a mountain.

NAME: Teaninich - 17 Year Old (2001) - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
A rare Teaninich, released as part of the Manager's Dram series. The bottles were released exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo. Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength. 
This release was bottled in September 2001 at 58.3%.  It is a 17 year old single malt from refill casks.  
 
Bottle 979.

NAME: Glen Elgin - 12 Year Old  White Horse (1980s)
DESCRIPTION:
Handcrafted in Speyside in pot stills, this 12-year-old is a classic.
Glen Elgin is situated on the outskirts of the Royal Burgh of Elgin on the banks of the River Lossie. 
Estimated to have been bottled in the 1980s at 43%.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1989 Valinch 'Lord Robertson'
DESCRIPTION:
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process. The term Valinch is a piece of old whisky terminology that comes from the Spanish & French. It is the word for a pipette that takes the samples from a cask. These bottlings were introduced to the public after the distillery was purchased in 2001 by Murray McDavid.
This bottling was distilled on 14th April 1989.
It bears a label that shows  Lord Robertson of Port Ellen. This Valinch was matured in refill sherry cask number #1009 and only 390 were produced. 
This is bottle number 10.

NAME: Glen Moray - Centenary - Port Wood Finish
DESCRIPTION:
A limited-edition and rare Glen Moray. This Centenary Vintage was finished in Port Wood was bottled to celebrate the distilleries 100th Anniversary in 1997.
Produced from four specially selected casks of Glen Moray, one from each vintage 1976 through to 1979. These casks where left to mature in ex-bourbon oak casks until 1987, when they were then transferred to Port Wood from the Douro Valley in Portugal.
This is bottle number 004110.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1990 Valinch 'Drambusters' (SIGNED)
DESCRIPTION:
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process. The term Valinch is a piece of old whisky terminology that comes from the Spanish & French. It is the word for a pipette that takes the samples from a cask. These bottlings were introduced to the public after the distillery was purchased in 2001 by Murray McDavid.
One of in the series of the single casks of Bruichladdich, this was released for the Drambusters which is a acrobatic flying team affiliated to Islay.
Only 487 bottles from cask #473 were produced. This was a bourbon cask.

NAME: Jura - Heavily Peated Speical Island Edition 1999
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Isle of Jura Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION:
From the neighbouring island to Islay, this is the famous heavily peated Jura from 1999. 
Distilled on the 27th January 1999 the liquid rested in cask #5000 and is one of only 500 bottles that have been produced on the 18th May 2006.

NAME: Arran - 21 Year Old Explorer Series Kildonan & Pladda Island Volume III
DESCRIPTION:
The isle of Arran is known for great whisky and equally stunning views. The explorers series are all limited editions of which this is the third release. Each release pays tribute to the stunning views that can be absorbed when visiting the island. 
Only 9000 bottles of the Kildonan & Pladda Island have been released. The dram within was matured in sherry butts and puncheons before being finished in Ruby Port casks.

NAME: Lagavulin - 1998 - Distillers Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Lagavulin 1998 Distillers Edition was double matured and was bottled in 2014 at 43% ABV.  Lagavulin is the most sought after bottling of the Distiller’s Edition range.
Batch No. lgv.4/503

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask Series #1933 - Dannebrog
DESCRIPTION: This release is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  It was bottled for the to celebrate the 808th year anniversary of the Danish flag ‘Dannebrog’.  The single malt was distilled in 2003, matured in Refill Butt 2016 #1933 for 13 years. This was a limited edition to only 648 bottles produced.

NAME: Port Charlotte - 10 Year Old - 2007 Cask Exploration #18
DESCRIPTION:
A Port Charlotte 2007 vintage matured for 10 years double-wood matured in cask #0016. Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 18 Cubaireachd. One of 372 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 81.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - 2002 Single Cask Series (Chris Maile, 13th Oslo Whisky Festival)
DESCRIPTION:
This Single Cask release by Highland Park has been matured for 13 years in a 1st fill European Sherry Hogshead cask #6352. This is one of just 306 bottles produced. 
This release was named in honour of Chris Maile, the whisky guru behind the Oslo Whisky Festival, the Trondheim Whisky Festival and the Arctic Whisky Festival). The bottling was officially released at the 13th Oslo Whisky Festival, in 2016.

NAME: Macallan - Whisky Maker's Edition - Classic Travel Range 1930s Ocean Liner
DESCRIPTION:
Released for the travel retail market, this single malt is part of The Macallan Whisky Maker's Edition Classic Travel Range.  It was crafted by Bob Dalgarno, Macallan's distillery manager, using whisky drawn from a combination of Sherry and bourbon casks.  It is bottled at his preferred strength of 42.8%. 
The range includes a set of 4 different bottle designs with x-ray photography celebrating the art of travel, designed by Nick Veasey.
This lot is the 1930's Oceanliner design.

NAME: Port Charlotte - 10 Year Old - 2004 Cask Exploration #03
DESCRIPTION:
A Port Charlotte 2004 vintage matured for 10 years in Sherry hogshead #953. Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 03 Bruthaich Dubh. One of 440 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 93.

NAME: Clynelish - 14 Year Old - Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION:
This is a rare bottling of Clynelish, which is part of the Flora and Fauna series.  This bottling has now discontinued.
Because of its popularity, it ended up having a spin-off for its own line of single malt whisky.

NAME: Dalwhinnie - 12 Year Old - Manager's Dram 2009
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 year old Dalwhinnie is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases.  The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo.  Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 57.5%.
 
This is bottle number 0968.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Fine Oak - Year of the Rat (2 x 70cl)
DESCRIPTION:
With bespoke label designs, this is an eye-catching limited-edition release twin pack containing 2 x 70cl bottles of The Macallan 12-year-old Double Cask single malt whisky.
The bottles and the presentation box feature artwork celebrating Chinese New Year 2020 (the year of the Rat).

NAME: Glenrothes - 20 Year Old 1989 First Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Direct wines, owners of Laithwaites wines are an independent bottler and they release whiskies under the 'first cask' label. The series of single cask whiskies are all bottled at 46% ABV from a variety of distilleries (some of which are unidentified), for its customers to order by the mixed case.
From the Speyside distillery, this bottling was distilled on the 31st December 1989 and comes from cask #24379. 
Bottle 92.

NAME: Highland Park - 18 Year Old 1989 First Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Direct wines, owners of Laithwaites wines are an independent bottler and they release whiskies under the 'first cask' label. The series of single cask whiskies are all bottled at 46% ABV from a variety of distilleries (some of which are unidentified), for its customers to order by the mixed case.
From the Orcadian giant, this Highland Park was distilled in 1989 and matured for 18 years. 
Bottle 599.

NAME: Miltonduff - 24 Year Old 1983 First Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Direct wines, owners of Laithwaites wines are an independent bottler and they release whiskies under the 'first cask' label. The series of single cask whiskies are all bottled at 46% ABV from a variety of distilleries (some of which are unidentified), for its customers to order by the mixed case.
Distilled on the 11th November 1983, this is a 24 year old single malt whisky from Miltonduff.
Bottle 149.

NAME: Miltonduff - 24 Year Old 1983 First Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Direct wines, owners of Laithwaites wines are an independent bottler and they release whiskies under the 'first cask' label. The series of single cask whiskies are all bottled at 46% ABV from a variety of distilleries (some of which are unidentified), for its customers to order by the mixed case.
Distilled on the 11th November 1983, this is a 24 year old single malt whisky from Miltonduff.
Bottle 114.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ballykilcavan 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Ballykilcavan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - 200th Anniversary Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members.  Today, it is the biggest selling single malt from Islay, and one of the last distilleries using its own floor maltings.
A limited edition that was released during Laphroaig open day at the Feis Ile 2015, to celebrate 200 years of Laphroaig.
For this special edition, Cairdeas Master Distiller John Campbell used 100% floor malted barley (from the distillery’s own small malting floor) and used only the two smaller, older stills during distillation. It was also fully matured in Warehouse No.1, right by the sea on Islay.
Laphroaig truly wanted to ensure this was a special release for their 200th Anniversary and is John’s interpretation of how Laphroaig would have been produced 200 years ago.  It was matured in ex-bourbon casks for 12 years.

NAME: Blanton's - Single Barrel Gold Edition #552
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's are famous for producing the first single barrel bourbon in the USA.
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
Drawn from a single barrel, number 552, which was stored on rick number 17. Each bottling is individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand.

NAME: Blanton's - Single Barrel Gold Edition #552
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's are famous for producing the first single barrel bourbon in the USA.
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
Drawn from a single barrel, number 552, which was stored on rick number 17. Each bottling is individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand.

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2010 - Amontillado Finish - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 6 years in classic bourbon barrels, after which the single malt was transferred to Amontillado sherry Hogsheads for another three years.  It was bottled at 56.9% and was released by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1658 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 1279.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2003 - Amontillado Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 2019 distillery exclusive from Bunnahabhain Distillery. This Amontillado Cask Finish limited edition started life on the 20th of February 2003 in refill hogsheads before being transferred to Amontillado sherry hogsheads on the 26th of February 2016 where it spent two more years maturing in Bunnahabhain's coastal warehouses.
This is one of 1710 bottles.
This is bottle number 1366.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2010 - Amontillado Finish - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 6 years in classic bourbon barrels, after which the single malt was transferred to Amontillado sherry Hogsheads for another three years.  It was bottled at 56.9% and was released by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1658 bottles produced.
Bottle 119.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2010 - Amontillado Finish - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 6 years in classic bourbon barrels, after which the single malt was transferred to Amontillado sherry Hogsheads for another three years.  It was bottled at 56.9% and was released by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1658 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 0411.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Feis Ile 2008
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This bottling was created to celebrate the 2008 Feis Ile.

NAME: Highland Park - 18 Year Old (2000s)
DESCRIPTION: This 18-year-old Highland Park is an old presentation from the early 2000s. The dumpy style bottle was used from 1999 until Highland Park was redesigned in the mid-2000s.

NAME: Highland Park - 17 Year Old - Ice
DESCRIPTION:
Following on from The Valhalla Collection, this limited edition Highland Park also comes with a cradle, which is shaped like a mountain as opposed to a longship.
Matured mostly in bourbon casks, this bottling was released in honour of the Ice Realm of Niflheim (hence the cut blue glass bottle). This land of perpetual ice and cold is home to the frozen river of Elivágar and the well of Hvergelmir! There are Nine Worlds in Norse mythology, but this two-part series is completed by Highland Park Fire Edition.

NAME: Laphroaig - 15 Year Old - 200th Anniversary Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This limited release 15-year-old Laphroaig single malt was bottled to commemorate Laphroigs 200th Anniversary.  To mark their bicentenary they brought back their 15-Year-Old for a limited edition release.  Laphroaig 15 Year Old was first released in the 1980s, but it was eventually replaced with the Laphroaig 18 Year Old.

NAME: Glenlivet - Wilson & Morgan - 25 Year Old.
DESCRIPTION:
A vintage Glenlivet single malt imported by Rossi & Rossi - Treviso.
It was distilled in 1974 and bottled in 1999 at 46% for the Wilson and Morgan Barrel Selection.

NAME: Dalwhinnie - 12 Year Old - Manager's Dram 2009
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 year old Dalwhinnie is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases.  The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo.  Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 57.5%.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - 200th Anniversary Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members.  Today, it is the biggest selling single malt from Islay, and one of the last distilleries using its own floor maltings.
A limited edition that was released during Laphroaig open day at the Feis Ile 2015, to celebrate 200 years of Laphroaig.
For this special edition, Cairdeas Master Distiller John Campbell used 100% floor malted barley (from the distillery’s own small malting floor) and used only the two smaller, older stills during distillation. It was also fully matured in Warehouse No.1, right by the sea on Islay.
Laphroaig truly wanted to ensure this was a special release for their 200th Anniversary and is John’s interpretation of how Laphroaig would have been produced 200 years ago.  It was matured in ex-bourbon casks for 12 years.

NAME: Inchgower -13 Year Old - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 13 year old is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases. The bottles were released exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo. Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength. 
This release was bottled in 2007 at 58.9%.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Fire
DESCRIPTION: This stunning Highland Park 15 year old single malt follows the 'Ice' edition to complete this Highland Park two-part series. The 'Fire' edition celebrates Muspelheim, the glowing Norse fire realm of destruction.  The malt was matured in refill Port casks and bottled at 45.2% abv. It's presented in a cradle shaped like a mountain.

NAME: Auchroisk - 16 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 16 year old single malt from the Auchroisk Distillery is part of The Manager's Dram series exclusively for Diageo employees (formerly United Distillers).  It was bottled in November 2015 at 55.6%. 
The Diageo Managers Dram bottlings, each selected by distillery managers, are bottled at natural cask strength.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

NAME: Royal Lochnagar - 12 Year Old 1970s 75cl
DESCRIPTION: Bottles for the Italian market in the early 1970s, this stunning highland malt from Royal Lochnagar has been aged for 12 years.

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: Glen Marnoch - 25 Year Old Speyside Single Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Aldi commissioned this bottling to celebrate the 25th anniversary of their presence in Scotland. The dram within is from unnamed distillery in Speyside and has been aged in American oak casks.
It was released in 2019 and is the Christmas release of Glen Marnoch.
Distilled at an unnamed Speyside distillery this malt

NAME: Macallan - Aera
DESCRIPTION: Released in 2018 for the Taiwanese market, Macallan Aera was matured in seasoned sherry casks and features lots of dried fruit flavours on the palate.  It was bottled at 40% ABV and as the label says, it was made with some thoughtfulness in mind.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2010 - Amontillado Finish - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 6 years in classic bourbon barrels, after which the single malt was transferred to Amontillado sherry Hogsheads for another three years.  It was bottled at 56.9% and was released by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1658 bottles produced.

NAME: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #2791 - Heathrow and World of Whiskies
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Heathrow and World of Whiskies.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 14 years in refill butt #2791 and was bottled at the cask strength of 58.2% ABV.  With only 588 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old #6120 2004 Valletta
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
Distilled in 2004 and bottled in 2018 this 13 year old was bottled exclusively for Valletta. It comes from cask #6120 and was matured in a Refill Puncheon.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask Series Germany #5886
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 12 Year Old is part of the single cask series by the Island Distillery.
Matured in a Refill Hogshead and bottled in 2016.
Distilled in 2005 this released was limited to 630 bottles exclusively produced for GERMANY.

NAME: Arran - 21 Year Old Explorer Series Kildonan & Pladda Island Volume III
DESCRIPTION:
The isle of Arran is known for great whisky and equally stunning views. The explorers series are all limited editions of which this is the third release. Each release pays tribute to the stunning views that can be absorbed when visiting the island. 
Only 9000 bottles of the Kildonan & Pladda Island have been released. The dram within was matured in sherry butts and puncheons before being finished in Ruby Port casks.

NAME: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #3793 - Austria
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Austria.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in refill Puncheon #3793 and was bottled at the cask strength of 62.6% ABV.  With only 642 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Bimber - Ex-bourbon - Small Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1948 bottles in the Bimber Ex-bourbon Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels. 
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled in May 2020.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #3787 - Russia
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Russia.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in Refill Puncheon #3787 at the cask strength of 63.8% ABV.  With only 570 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

NAME: Springbank - 15 Year Old - Rum Wood (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited edition, single malt Scotch whisky from Springbank distillery bottled and released in 2019.  The whisky was fully matured in rum casks for 15 years.   Bottled at a cask strength of 51.0% this is one of only 9,000 bottles released worldwide.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old Single Cask #1938 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An Orkney favourite in this Highland Park single cask which has been matured for 15 years in a 1st Fill American Sherry Oak Puncheon
572 bottles were produced from this cask #1938.

NAME: Balvenie - 15 Year Old Single Barrel #11168
DESCRIPTION:
This bottle is one of no more than 800 bottles drawn from the single cask number 11168. Matured in a European Oak Sherry Butt for at least 15 years before being selected by David Stewart, the Balvenie Malt Master. 
Bottle 492.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

NAME: Lagavulin - 10 Year Old - Travel Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
The distillery is said to be the birthplace of distilling on Islay. The rich and intenseness of the flavours infuse the senses with delight.
A travel exclusive from the Islay company, in Port Ellen Isle of Islay.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #2865 - Draken (75cl)
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Draken (USA).  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 13 years in Refill Sherry Butt, then bottled at the cask strength of 64.3% ABV.  With only 444 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Parks last batch of the 18 Year Old single malt before the new packaging of the 18 Year Old Viking Pride.
756 bottles were hand signed by Whisky Makers Max McFarlane and Gordon Motion.

NAME: Bowmore - 15 Year Old - Distillery Excluisve - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of Bowmore's Fèis Ìle distillery exclusive releases of 2019.  It was created through a marriage of some of their finest bourbon casks.  The 15 year old single malt has notes of oak spice and bergamont balanced with the sweetness of candied orange shortbread.  This is one of 3000 individually numbered bottles.
Bottle 2412.

NAME: Wolfburn - Takashimaya
DESCRIPTION: Bottled for Japanese department store company Takashimaya and made from just two specially selected casks.  This exclusive bottling is one of just 500 bottles produced at 50% abv.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old #5734 Viking Line
DESCRIPTION:
