Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Viking Line. Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in a refill Butt #5734 at the cask strength of 63.1% ABV in 2018.  With only 300 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Inchgower - 12 Year Old (1980s)
DESCRIPTION: Inchgower 12 a de luxe Highland malt whisky (actually Speyside) from the House of Bells.

NAME: Highland Park - 18 Year Old Single Cask #2865 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An Orkney favourite in this Highland Park single cask which has been matured for 18 years in American Oak Butt #2865..
606 bottles were produced from this cask.

NAME: Teaninich - 17 Year Old (2001) - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
A rare Teaninich, released as part of the Manager's Dram series. The bottles were released exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo. Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength. 
This release was bottled in September 2001 at 58.3%.  It is a 17 year old single malt from refill casks.  
 
This is bottle 1401.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Fire
DESCRIPTION: This stunning Highland Park 15 year old single malt follows the 'Ice' edition to complete this Highland Park two-part series. The 'Fire' edition celebrates Muspelheim, the glowing Norse fire realm of destruction.  The malt was matured in refill Port casks and bottled at 45.2% abv. It's presented in a cradle shaped like a mountain.

NAME: Royal Lochnagar - 12 Year Old 1980s
DESCRIPTION:
In 1848, the Royal Warrant was awarded to the distillery following a visit from Prince Albert and Queen Victoria. The distillery was mainly producing whisky to be part of Scottish blends, however, John Beggs blends became so famous, the distillery was bought by John Dewar & Sons in 1916. 
Diageo is now the proprietors of the distillery which is unusual because of their low capacity. This is an early example of a bottle from the 1980s after being matured for at least 12 years.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Fire
DESCRIPTION: This stunning Highland Park 15 year old single malt follows the 'Ice' edition to complete this Highland Park two-part series. The 'Fire' edition celebrates Muspelheim, the glowing Norse fire realm of destruction.  The malt was matured in refill Port casks and bottled at 45.2% abv. It's presented in a cradle shaped like a mountain.

NAME: Port Charlotte - 10 Year Old - 2005 Cask Exploration #08
DESCRIPTION:
A Port Charlotte 2005 vintage matured for 10 years in Rioja cask #2286.  Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 08 Buain-Mhona. One of 572 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 3.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Port Charlotte - 11 Year Old - 2004 Cask Exploration #11
DESCRIPTION:
A Port Charlotte 2004 vintage matured for 11 years in VDN cask #R12/202-010. Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 11 Taigh A'Mhuilinn. One of 430 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 12.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1989 Valinch 'The Tonga Valinch'
DESCRIPTION:
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process. The term Valinch is a piece of old whisky terminology that comes from the Spanish & French. It is the word for a pipette that takes the samples from a cask. These bottlings were introduced to the public after the distillery was purchased in 2001 by Murray McDavid.
Bottled to celebrate the visit of HRH Crown Prince Tupouto'a Tupou V. This single malt from Bruichladdich was distilled in 1989 and matured in Bourbon Barrel #1880.
It is one of 330 bottles
Bottle #19.

NAME: Bruichladdich -  X4 +1 - Deliverance - Feis Ile 2008
DESCRIPTION:
Bruichladdich X4 +1 Deliverance was quadruple distilled in March 2007 and bottled for the Islay Festival in just over a year later in 2008 at 65.4%.  This Bruichladdich new spirit was matured in cask 069 and is one of 800 bottles.
 
This is bottle number 595.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.2 - 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

NAME: Macallan - Whisky Maker's Edition - Classic Travel Range 1930s Propeller Plane
DESCRIPTION:
Released for the travel retail market, this single malt is part of The Macallan Whisky Maker's Edition Classic Travel Range.  It was crafted by Bob Dalgarno, Macallan's distillery manager, using whisky drawn from a combination of Sherry and bourbon casks.  It is bottled at his preferred strength of 42.8%. 
The range includes a set of 4 different bottle labels and outer boxes, with x-ray photography celebrating the art of travel, designed by Nick Veasey.
This lot is the 1930's propeller plane design which features both on the bottle lable and on the outer box.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.2 - 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

NAME: Glen Grant - 27 Year Old #20291 Bladnoch Forum
DESCRIPTION:
From ScotchWhisky...
"When Bladnoch distillery was bought by Raymond Armstrong he started an online forum to keep fans and whisky enthusiasts informed about the distillery’s progress and news.
This forum was also used as a means to bottle and sell single casks of other whiskies. The bottlings were all at cask strength and were notable for their extremely fair prices at the time. Bottlings include a variety of Port Ellens and some extremely limited aged single grains. "
This bottling is a Speyside single malt that has been aged for 27 years. It was distilled at Glen Grant.

NAME: Yamazaki - 10 Year Old 18cl
DESCRIPTION: This 10 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in the late 1980s and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

NAME: Glenkinchie - 20 Year Old 1987 First Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Direct wines, owners of Laithwaites wines are an independent bottler and they release whiskies under the 'first cask' label. The series of single cask whiskies are all bottled at 46% ABV from a variety of distilleries (some of which are unidentified), for its customers to order by the mixed case.
Distilled on the 22nd of October 1987 and aged for 20 years at Glenkinchie Distillery. This is cask #2845.
Bottle 33.

NAME: Glenburgie - 25 Year Old 1992 Old Particular
DESCRIPTION: Only 270 bottles of this single malt scotch whisky have been produced from the Glen Burgie distillery. Distilled in April 1992 this cask strength expression was aged for 25 years before being bottled by the family-owned firm Douglas Laing for their Old Particular Label.

NAME: Caol Ila - 18 Year Old 1984 First Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Direct wines, owners of Laithwaites wines are an independent bottler and they release whiskies under the 'first cask' label. The series of single cask whiskies are all bottled at 46% ABV from a variety of distilleries (some of which are unidentified), for its customers to order by the mixed case.
Distilled on the 27th of November on Islay at the Distillery in 1984. This cask was bottled at 18 years of age.
Bottle 130.

NAME: Glenmorangie - Companta (Private Edition)
DESCRIPTION:
'Companta' by Glenmorangie, follows on from 'Ealanta', which was named as World Whisky of the Year 2014 by Jim Murray. 'This Private Edition Companta was a very popular release, selling out quickly from most retailers.
After first maturing in American white oak ex-bourbon barrels, the Companta was matured in 60% Burgundy wine casks from Clos de Tart and 40% Rhône Valley casks that previously held Rasteau, sourced by Glenmorangie's Director of Distilling, Dr. Bill Lumsden.
The result is an exceedingly well-made cherry red, non-chill-filtered single malt that fits perfectly into the continuing range of experimental releases from Glenmorangie.

NAME: Ardbeg - Grooves (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt.  The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

NAME: Highland Park - Viking Collection - 1997 The Sword
DESCRIPTION: This is a rare 1997 vintage release of Highland Park single malt that was released as part of the Viking Collection. It was originally bottled for Taiwan and the distillery shop.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Bannow Island 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Bannow Island 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was distilled using a single vintage of Overture barley grown on the south coast of Co. Wexford by Ed Harpur on his Bannow Island farm.  Matured in French and American oak casks, and bottled at 50% ABV with no chill-filtration or additional colouring.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Origin - 2012
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 2012 bottling combines some of the original liquid used to create càideas, further matured and complemented with newer Laphroaig spirit that has been fully matured in quarter casks.

NAME: Highland Park - Sigurd
DESCRIPTION: Highland Park Sigurd was originally a Travel Retail Exclusive and was released as part of the warrior series.  It was partially matured in European oak. It is named after a legendary hero of Norse mythology.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

NAME: Springbank - 10 Year Old (Old Version)
DESCRIPTION:
With lowland whiskies coming into the spotlight of late, this older style Springbank is starting to become more and more collectable.
Every stage of making the whisky, from malting to bottling, is done on-site at Springbank.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Springbank - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 18-year-old is full of authority and is truly a classic, full-bodied dram. With a delicious nose, this whisky will tempt you in and hold your attention as you uncover its unique palate and finish.

NAME: Lagavulin  - 200th Anniversary Tasting Companion Set (Including Booklet)
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition Lagavulin 200th Anniversary Tasting Companion Set includes small samples of:
This lot contains the Lagavulin 200 years booklet.

NAME: Macallan - Classic Cut - 2017 (75cl)
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Classic Cut - 2017 edition is the first release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 58.4%.  This is a 75cl bottling.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

NAME: Highland Park - 18 Year Old (2000s)
DESCRIPTION: This 18-year-old Highland Park is an old presentation from the early 2000s. The dumpy style bottle was used from 1999 until Highland Park was redesigned in the mid-2000s.

NAME: Glendronach - 14 Year Old - Virgin Oak
DESCRIPTION: This 14 year old by Glendronach was initially matured re-charred puncheons and then finished in a very small batch of American Virgin Oak casks.

NAME: Blanton’s - Single Barrel Bourbon Original #144 128.5Proof
DESCRIPTION:
Without chill-filtration or additional colouring, this bottling was drawn from a single bourbon barrel.
Blanton's are known for their top-quality bourbon and this bottling is no different.  
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
This comes from barrel number 144 and stored at rick 35.

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: Bunnahabhain  - 18 Year Old - XVIII
DESCRIPTION: Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old is part of their core range. Becomes more and more desirable in the Asian markets, it packs a punch! You will go a long way to find a dram with more depth.

NAME: Blanton’s - Single Barrel Bourbon Original #144 128.5Proof
DESCRIPTION:
Without chill-filtration or additional colouring, this bottling was drawn from a single bourbon barrel.
Blanton's are known for their top-quality bourbon and this bottling is no different.  
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
This comes from barrel number 144 and stored at rick 35.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1988 Valinch 'The Mayor of Islay'
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1988, this Bruichladdich was matured in a single sherry cask #1184. Bottled in honour of the Mayor of Islay, this is part of the 50cl 'Valinch' series.
The bottle when first released was only available to purchase from the distillery. However, now as you can see, you have the chance to buy it with The Grand Whisky Auction. 
Only 375 bottles were produced.
This is bottle 157.

NAME: Scapa - 16 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is an increasingly popular dram - after a controversial bebinning for the 16 year old official expression of Scapa, it is now winning people over. An increase in quality after a few under-par years following the rapid transition from the much-loved 12 year old via the short-lived 14 year old has started to turn things around.

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: Bowmore - 15 Year Old - Distillery Excluisve - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of Bowmore's Fèis Ìle distillery exclusive releases of 2019.  It was created through a marriage of some of their finest bourbon casks.  The 15 year old single malt has notes of oak spice and bergamont balanced with the sweetness of candied orange shortbread.  This is one of 3000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 2162.

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas Ileach Edition Feis Ile 2011
DESCRIPTION:
In 2011 the Feis Ile festival releases this Cairdeas from Laphroig.
Master Distiller, John Campbell, created the 'Ileach Edition'. He is the first Islay native to be in this position at Laphroaig.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.5
DESCRIPTION: The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

NAME: Highland Park - Single Cask Series -Taiwan Duty Free Exclusive #4303
DESCRIPTION: This 13 Year Old Highland Park was bottled as a Taiwan Duty-Free Exclusive release.  It is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  Distilled in 2004, the single malt was matured in refill butt #4303 for 14 years and was bottled in 2017 at 63.1% ABV.  This a limited release of just 624 bottles.

NAME: Knockando - 12 Year Old - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 year old from Knockando is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram Series.  The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo.  Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 59%.
Bottle 999.

NAME: Glenkinchie - 15 Year Old - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 15 Year Old Glenkinchie is part of the Manager’s Dram Series, which were available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo. These whiskies were specially selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
This is a numbered bottle.
1498

NAME: Wilson & Morgan - 25 Year Old.
DESCRIPTION:
This blended malt is imported by Rossi & Rossi - Treviso.
It was distilled in 1993 and bottled in 2018 at cask strenght 53.7% from cask #DRU15A508 for the Wilson and Morgan Barrel Selection. This bottle was matured in sherry wood.

NAME: Dufftown - 14 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION: From The Manager's Dram range (a series of releases for Diageo staff members featuring whiskies picked out by distillery managers) comes a 14 year old single malt from Dufftown. The label features a golden salmon jumping over a picture of the distillery.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #6577 - Belgium
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Belgium.  Distilled in 2004, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill butt #6577 at the cask strength of 64.1% ABV.  With only 594 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: The Last Hunter - 25 Year Old Speyside Blend
DESCRIPTION:
A blended malt that was distilled in 1939. This happens to be the same year that RAF Kinloss opened.
It is a blend from G&M and was bottled at 41.6% which...wait for it...is 73 Proof which is the same number of years that the base was open.
Fantastic.

NAME: Kilchoman - 12 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: Due to the cancellation of Fèis Ìle 2020, this year's Kilchoman festival release was an online exclusive and is one of just 2630 bottles available.  Matured in ex-bourbon barrels for a minimum of 12 years and bottled at the cask strength (54.2%).

NAME: Glenmorangie - Companta (Private Edition)
DESCRIPTION:
'Companta' by Glenmorangie, follows on from 'Ealanta', which was named as World Whisky of the Year 2014 by Jim Murray. 'This Private Edition Companta was a very popular release, selling out quickly from most retailers.
After first maturing in American white oak ex-bourbon barrels, the Companta was matured in 60% Burgundy wine casks from Clos de Tart and 40% Rhône Valley casks that previously held Rasteau, sourced by Glenmorangie's Director of Distilling, Dr. Bill Lumsden.
The result is an exceedingly well-made cherry red, non-chill-filtered single malt that fits perfectly into the continuing range of experimental releases from Glenmorangie.

NAME: Macallan - 26 Year Old Miniature 5cl 1966
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in sherry wood for 26 years comes this 5cl miniature of Macallan.
Regularly setting records at auctions, The Macallan minis are one of the most sought after in the world.

NAME: Springbank - 15 Year Old - Rum Wood (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited edition, single malt Scotch whisky from Springbank distillery bottled and released in 2019.  The whisky was fully matured in rum casks for 15 years.   Bottled at a cask strength of 51.0% this is one of only 9,000 bottles released worldwide.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #3374 - Loch Fyne Whiskies
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Loch Fyne Whiskies.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 15 years in refill butt #3374 at the cask strength of 58.4% ABV.  With only 584 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Widow Jane - 4 Year Old La Maison du Whisky Bourbon 35cl
DESCRIPTION:
This is a limited edition bourbon that is made from ingredients New York State. They include -
It was bottled for La Maison du Whisky and is 4 years old.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

NAME: Highland Park - 11 Year Old - Single Cask #3720 - Munich Airport
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Munich Airport.  Distilled in 2006, this single malt was matured for 11 years in refill butt #3720 was bottled at the cask strength of 64.5% ABV.  With only 324 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Brackla - 16 Year Old 1979 Signatory
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled by the Indy bottler Signatory, this dram has been aged for 16 years. It was distilled at the Royal Brackla distillery in the Highlands of Scotland on the 26th of Feb 1979. 
Only 596 bottles were produced. 
This is bottle number 454.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #1765 - Amsterdam Airport
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Amsterdam Airport.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill butt #1765 at a cask strength of 63.4% ABV.  With only 471 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old 2007 Houston We’ve Had A Problem
DESCRIPTION:
A 2007 vintage Orcadian single malt Scotch whisky from Highland Park to commemorate the 50th Anniversary of the Apollo 13 Moon Mission in 1970.
It was bottled from a single cask refill Oloroso hogshead #TWB1011.
This release was exclusive to The Whisky Barrel and only 322 bottles were released.

NAME: Kirk and Sweeney - 23 Year Old rum
DESCRIPTION:
From the Caribean nation that is best known for its beaches and golfs resorts...and now its Rum. 
This cracking 23 year old comes from an undisclosed Dominican distillery. 
Batch: 004
This is bottle number 8348.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Mortlach - Spirit of Speyside Festival 2013
DESCRIPTION:
The Spirit of Speyside Festival, in the heart of Scotland, occurs annually and hosts people that travel from all over the world to visit and partake in distillery tours & tastings.
Mortlach released this bottle for the Spirit of Speyside Festival 2013, which is a limited edition and a combination of hand-picked casks to represent the special aspects of Mortlach.

NAME: Macallan - Classic Cut - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Classic Cut - 2018 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 51.2% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #6313 - Helluland
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Helluland.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in Refill Puncheon #6313 at the cask strength of 61.3% ABV.  With only 510 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

NAME: The Glover - 14 Year Old - Adelphi
DESCRIPTION: A 14-Year-Old blend that is a fusion of Japanese and Scottish malt, in celebration of Thomas Glover - a Scotsman that moved to Japan and set up The Japan Brewery Company and the company that would become Mitsubishi.  This is one of 1500 bottles.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #2154 - The Whiskey House
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for The Whiskey House.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 15 years in First Fill American Sherry Butt #2154 at the cask strength of 61.8% ABV.  With only 606 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Balvenie - 15 Year Old Single Barrel #11168
DESCRIPTION:
This bottle is one of no more than 800 bottles drawn from the single cask number 11168. Matured in a European Oak Sherry Butt for at least 15 years before being selected by David Stewart, the Balvenie Malt Master. 
Bottle 497

NAME: The Glover - 18 Year Old Adelphi 2017 Release
DESCRIPTION: A 18-Year-Old blend that is a fusion of Japanese and Scottish malt, in celebration of Thomas Glover - a Scotsman that moved to Japan and set up The Japan Brewery Company and the company that would become Mitsubishi.  This is one of 1406 bottles.

NAME: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #6140 - Routa
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Routa.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 14 years in first fill European Sherry Butt #6140 at a cask strength of 59.5% ABV.  With only 645 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #6313 - Helluland
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Helluland.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in Refill Puncheon #6313 then bottled at the cask strength of 61.3% ABV.  With only 510 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 10 Year Old (1980s)
DESCRIPTION: The 1980s' release of Bruichladdich 10-year-old single malt. This is a 75cl bottling.

NAME: Ben Nevis - 20 Year Old 1997 - Old Particular - King of the Hills
DESCRIPTION: Only 626  bottles of this 1997 vintage Ben Nevis were charged from a single Refill butt by Douglas Laing, for their Old Particular Range in May 2017.  This is the second release in Douglas Laing's Consortium of Cards series, named King of the Hills.

NAME: Scapa - 16 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is an increasingly popular dram - after a controversial bebinning for the 16 year old official expression of Scapa, it is now winning people over. An increase in quality after a few under-par years following the rapid transition from the much-loved 12 year old via the short-lived 14 year old has started to turn things around.

NAME: Glenlivet - Cipher
DESCRIPTION: A limited-edition single malt whisky from The Glenlivet's Master Distiller, Alan Winchester.  The Glenlivet Cipher comes in an opaque black bottle without cask information, tasting notes and age statement.  This bottle is surrounded by mystery.  You are encouraged to find the secret flavour hidden on the bottle label and visit the Cipher website for full tasting notes.

NAME: Ardbeg - Grooves (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt.  The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

NAME: Highland Park - 11 Year Old - Single Cask #2132 - The W Club
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for The W Club.  Distilled in 2006, this single malt was matured for 11 years in first fill American Sherry Oak Puncheon #2132 and was bottled at the cask strength of 67% ABV.  With only 615 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

NAME: Ardbeg - Grooves (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt.  The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

NAME: Highland Park - 14 Year Old Single Cask #3376 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An Orkney favourite in this Highland Park single cask which has been matured for 14 years in Refill Butt #3376.
582 bottles were produced from this cask at the natural cask strength of 57.8%.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Scapa - 16 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is an increasingly popular dram - after a controversial bebinning for the 16 year old official expression of Scapa, it is now winning people over. An increase in quality after a few under-par years following the rapid transition from the much-loved 12 year old via the short-lived 14 year old has started to turn things around.

NAME: Scapa - 14 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 14 Year Old from Scapa Distillery was a shortlived bottling -it was introduced by Chivas Brothers to replace the old 12 Year Old, but was subsequently replaced by their 16 year old standard official bottling.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1990 Valinch 'Viking Visit'
DESCRIPTION:
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process.
This particular bottling commemorates the visit of a replica longboat that was found and preserved in clay in Olso in July 2005.
Only 348 bottles were ever released after maturing in a refill bourbon squat hogshead #716. 
Bottle number 20.

NAME: Benrinnes - 15 Year Old Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION:
Benrinnes has always been known as a malt with great substance and it is said to be down to their triple distillation process. 
This bottling is part of the highly collectable series - Flora and Fauna. 
The distillery is on the Northern shoulder of Ben Rinnes (Mountain) and is 700ft above sea level.

NAME: Ardbeg - Grooves (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt.  The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #5715 - Grundtvig
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Grundtvig. This is edition 1 in the Founders series.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill butt #5715 at the cask strength of 61.3% ABV.  With only 624 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1990 Valinch 'From Red to Black'
DESCRIPTION:
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process. The term Valinch is a piece of old whisky terminology that comes from the Spanish & French. It is the word for a pipette that takes the samples from a cask. These bottlings were introduced to the public after the distillery was purchased in 2001 by Murray McDavid.
Distilled in 1990, the liquid was filled into a refill sherry #1031. This single cask was bottled on the 11th November 2004 and yielded 400 bottles. 
This bottling was commissioned because it finally started to turn a profit in 2004 going from the red into the black.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Years Old - Single Cask Series Aberdeen Airport #3631
DESCRIPTION: This Highland Park Single Cask Edition was bottled in 2018 exclusively for Aberdeen International Airport and World of Whiskies.  With just 610 bottles available, the 12-year-old single malt whisky is drawn from an intriguing mix of American/Spanish oak cask and bottled at a cask strength 64.4% ABV.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Clynelish - 1991 Distillers Edition 2006
DESCRIPTION:
This 1991 vintage Clynelish single malt double matured in Oloroso Seco cask wood casks. Bottled in 2006 at 46% by Diageo for their Distillers Edition series.  This is an early bottling in the series, a very collectable bottling.
Special Release: Cl-BR:169-IF

NAME: Dufftown - 15 Year Old Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION: Distilled and matured in Speyside, this Dufftown 15 year old is part of Diageo Flora and Fauna range. It has had some great reviews and the bottles are only becoming harder and harder to source.

NAME: Arran Devil’s Punch Bowl Chapter III
DESCRIPTION:
The isle of Arran is known for great whisky and equally stunning views. The distillery has been established since 1995 and swept the whisky nation like a winter storm passing over the Island!
The first single malt from the distillery was a limited edition 3 year old in 1998. 
This release came to the world in 2014 and is the final and third release in the series. (Devil's Punch Bowl).
21 casks were used and the following combination made up the vat.
Only 6600 bottles were ever released...calculated or meant to be?

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Yamazaki - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

NAME: Auchentoshan - 1981 First Cask #1161
DESCRIPTION:
An Auchentoshan 15 Year Old that was distilled on 19 March 1981 and bottled from a single cask.
Bottled by Direct Wines Limited for their First Cask series and was only available exclusively to First Cask Circle Members.
 
Bottle number 11 from cask number 1161.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 19 Year Old  1989 First Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Direct wines, owners of Laithwaites wines are an independent bottler and they release whiskies under the 'first cask' label. The series of single cask whiskies are all bottled at 46% ABV from a variety of distilleries (some of which are unidentified), for its customers to order by the mixed case.
It was distilled on the 2nd of November 1989 and filled into cask 96.
This is bottle 206.

NAME: Bushmills - 21 Year Old - Triple Distilled
DESCRIPTION:
This 21 year old bottling by Bushmills has been triple distilled firstly in Oloroso sherry and Bourbon casks for at least 19 years and then followed by Maderia Casks for the final 2 years. The unique flavours of wood give this 21 year old whisky an enjoyable depth flavour.  
This is bottle number 24944/2013.

NAME: Ardbeg - The Story of Peat  - Mini Gift Pack (4 x 5cl)
DESCRIPTION: An intriguing peat box containing a peat book, expertly penned by whisky expert Jim Murray. With it, four evidential samples of Ardbeg expressions, each with its own peaty tale to tell! There's the famous punch of 10 Years Old, begging comparison with the subtle and extremely rare 17 Years Old, while the smoky flavours of Uigeadail await contrast with lightly peated Kildalton, never before bottled in miniature…

NAME: Islay House - 2004 Port Charlotte - Fèis Ìle 2015
DESCRIPTION:
This limited-edition single-cask bottling of Bruichladdich's Port Charlotte was distilled in 2004 and released at Feis Ile in 2015.  It was matured in a Cadiz single cask and bottled at 55% ABV.  It was exclusively available from the Islay House hotel, which was in the middle of being refurbished before their planned reopening.  This is one of 334 individually numbered bottles.
Bottle number 309 and this lot comes with branded glass.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 11 Year Old - 2007 French Brandy Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Most of the whisky coming from the distillery prior to 2012 was lightly peated. However, in 2012 a change was to come...
Approximately 20% of production contains 35-45ppm peat.
A limited release from warehouse number 8 and distilled in 2007. This beauty is finished in a French Brandy Cask. Bottled in 2019. 
This is bottle number 1662.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 7 Year Old - 2003 Port Cask Inspiration - Robin Laing
DESCRIPTION: Robin Laing - The Whisky Bard, a Scottish folk musician that collaborated with Bruichladdich in 2011. The album and this bottling share the name 'Inspiration'.

NAME: Scapa - 16 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is an increasingly popular dram - after a controversial bebinning for the 16 year old official expression of Scapa, it is now winning people over. An increase in quality after a few under-par years following the rapid transition from the much-loved 12 year old via the short-lived 14 year old has started to turn things around.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

NAME: Blanton’s - Single Barrel Bourbon Original #140 128.5Proof
DESCRIPTION:
Without chill-filtration or additional colouring, this bottling was drawn from a single bourbon barrel.
Blanton's are known for their top-quality bourbon and this bottling is no different.  
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
This comes from barrel number 140 and stored at rick 35.

NAME: Ardbeg - Grooves (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt.  The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.5
DESCRIPTION: The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

NAME: Scapa - 14 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 14 Year Old from Scapa Distillery was a shortlived bottling -it was introduced by Chivas Brothers to replace the old 12 Year Old, but was subsequently replaced by their 16 year old standard official bottling.

NAME: Scapa - 14 Year Old John Scott & Miller Ltd
DESCRIPTION:
Only 303 bottles were produced of this Orcadian malt. It comes from a refill Hogshead #1428.
Usually the old malt cask range was bottled at 50% ABV which was known as the golden strength because it reveals all the wonderful aspects of a malt.
This particular bottling is at 56.1%
Bottle 69.

NAME: Highland Park - Single Cask Series -Taiwan Duty Free Exclusive #4303
DESCRIPTION: This 13 Year Old Highland Park was bottled as a Taiwan Duty-Free Exclusive release.  It is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  Distilled in 2004, the single malt was matured in refill butt #4303 for 14 years and was bottled in 2017 at 63.1% ABV.  This a limited release of just 624 bottles.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ballykilcavan 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Ballykilcavan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. Made exclusively using Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis on his Ballykilcavan farm in Co. Laois. After distillation, the whiskey is matured in a combination of French and American oak, and then bottled at 50% ABV.

NAME: Bowmore - 7 Year Old - Premier Barrel - Douglas Laing
DESCRIPTION: This 7-year-old Bowmore, was bottled by independent bottler Douglas Laing.  This single barrel bottling is presented in a decanter & wooden box - this is one of just 150 produced.  This bottling was specially selected and bottled for Robbie's Drams.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #5715 - Grundtvig
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Grundtvig. This is edition 1 in the Founders series.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill butt #5715 at the cask strength of 61.3% ABV.  With only 624 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #1674 - Vintersolstandet
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Vintersolstandet. Distilled in 2001, this single malt was matured for 15 years in refill butt #1674 at a cask strength of 59% ABV.  With only 552 bottles available, this is a very limited edition.

NAME: Glen Grant - 2008 Single Cask #13156 - 50cl
DESCRIPTION: A limited edition bottling by Glen Grant with only 300 bottles. It was distilled on 14th Februray 2008 and bottled 11 years later on 29th March 2019 at cask strenght 57.2% ABV from cask #0013156.

NAME: Mortlach - 18 Year Old - Gleann Mor
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling of Mortlach was distilled in 1995 and bottled 18 years later in 2013 by independent bottler Gleann Mor.
One of 335 bottles.

NAME: Bimber - Ex-bourbon - Small Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1948 bottles in the Bimber Ex-bourbon Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels. 
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled in May 2020. 
 
This is bottle number 0952.

NAME: Cambus - 26 Year Old 1993 Douglas Laing #DL13914
DESCRIPTION: A single cask, single grain bottling from Cambus by Douglas Laing. Matured in cask #DL13914 for 26 years, this is one of just 217 bottles filled at the natural cask strength of 43.3%.

NAME: Ardbeg - 12 Year Old - Gleann Mor
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling of Ardbeg was distilled in April 2003 and bottled 12 years later in November 2015 by independent bottler Gleann Mor.
One of 263 bottles.

NAME: Glenallachie - 12 Year Old 2007 Single Cask #7169
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled and chosen by the magician...sorry, the master distiller Billy Walker. This single cask #7169 was bottled in May 2020 especially for a great outfit called the Inverurie whisky shop. Only 715 bottles were produced from this Oloroso Sherry Puncheon. 
This is bottle 257.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old 2003 Single Cask #1935 Calle Cask No.1
DESCRIPTION:
One from the Single Cask series brought to you by Highland Park, comes this 13 year old single malt.
It was distilled in 2003 and bottled for Calle Cask No.1 in 2016.
It is one of 654 Bottles and had been matured in refill butt #1935.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 2001 - Resurrection Dram (SIGNED)
DESCRIPTION:
This was the first release “Resurrection Dram” and is a celebration of a new era at Bruichladdich, the first distillation by Jim McEwan and his team in the more artisanal, old-fashioned way. Very lightly peated at 10ppm and matured in ex-bourbon casks for 8 years - a style never repeated since. It signifies the resurrection of a legend and the realisation of a dream.   
Signed by Andrew Gray.

NAME: Ardbeg - Grooves
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt.  The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

NAME: Bimber - Ex-bourbon - Small Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1948 bottles in the Bimber Ex-bourbon Batch 1 Small Batch release. It was firstly matured in 1st fill bourbon barrels. 
The batch number for this bottling is 01/2020 which was bottled in May 2020. 
 
Bottle 1518.

NAME: Macallan - Sienna
DESCRIPTION:
Sienna is a no age statement bottling, released as part of the sherry matured 1824 Series from The Macallan.
Matured in top quality sherry casks, this single malt is named Sienna to represent the naturally occurring pigment - referring not only to the hue of this expression but to the fact that The Macallan's whiskies are all released with no added colouring.

NAME: Linkwood - 11 Year Old Adephi 2008
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 2008 this dram is from Linkwood distiller and was bottled in 2020. It is one of only 309 bottles. 
The famous badge graces this bottle from Adelphi...Malt does more than milton can to justify gods ways to a man.
A.E. Housman

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #2966 - Bulgaria
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Bulgaria.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in Refill Hogshead #2966 at the cask strength of 63% ABV.  With only 318 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Aberlour - 12 Year Old 1980s
DESCRIPTION:
One of the most loved Speyside distilleries, this Aberlour is most well known for their series of A'bunah bottlings. 
This is a 1980's bottling that has been aged for 12 years. 
 
Aberlour is a picturesque Speyside distillery, owned nowadays by Pernod Ricard. The reverence for the sherry-casked A'Bunadh, launched in 1997, greatly boosted the popularity of the distillery, and its output from all eras is increasingly sought after.
A rare bottle of 12 year old Aberlour, bottled in the 1980s.

NAME: Highland Park - Hillhead (Keystone Series, Part 5)
DESCRIPTION: 'Hillhead' bottled at 46% ABV, marries both flavour and strength and was matured in three casks: European Oak Sherry, American Oak Sherry and American Oak Bourbon.  Hillhead was the last in a series of five special editions, showcasing Highland Park's five keystones of production.

NAME: Glen Grant - 21 Year Old SMWS 9.143 Graceful gravitas
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Speyside single malt has been matured for 21 years and is one of only 258 bottles produced. It was bottled to celebrate the Spirit of Speyside festival. It name... Graceful gravitas.

NAME: Bowmore - Sherriff's (1970s) (Mini)
DESCRIPTION: This is a rare miniature (1 1/3 Fl. Oz) bottling of an old bottling Bowmore from the days before the distillery was sold to Stanley P Morrison. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1970s.

NAME: Wolfburn - Kylver Series - 2nd Release
DESCRIPTION:
This is the second instalment in the Wolfburn Distillery Kylver series. 
This single malt whisky was drawn from a combination of bourbon barrels and second-fill ex-Oloroso Sherry. Released in May 2017 at 50% ABV. This is one of 1450 bottles. 
The Kylver series follows the Viking runic alphabet engraved on a large stone excavated in Gotland (Sweden) in 1903.  The fourth symbol  is called “Ansuz”, which roughly translates as “god” or “gods”.  
Wolfburn Distillery is located in Thurso, making it the Northern most distillery on the UK mainland.  Based around a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn reopened in 2013. 
The bottom of the box has 1172/1450 written on the front corner.

NAME: Singleton of Auchroisk - 1975
DESCRIPTION:
A rare old vintage bottling of the Singleton (when it was still from Auchroisk).
This is a 75cl bottle.

NAME: Collectivum XXVIII - 28 Famous Malts Limited Release
DESCRIPTION: This 2017 Special Releases is a blended malt and the first time one has been included in the series.  Collectivum XXVIII exceeds expections, and is an expertly blended expression that includes malt from every single operational Diageo distillery (28).

NAME: Ardbeg - Perpetuum
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

NAME: Strathmill - 15 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 15 year old single malt from the Strathmill Distillery is part of The Manager's Dram series exclusively for Diageo employees (formerly United Distillers).  It was bottled at 53.5%. 
The Diageo Managers Dram bottlings, each selected by distillery managers, are bottled at natural cask strength.
This is bottle number 1074.

NAME: Dalmore - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Dalmore’s trademark style is luscious notes of orange, chocolate and spices, and the 18 Year Old bottling is a terrific example. Aged in both bourbon and sherry casks, it has seductive notes of vanilla, dark chocolate and candied orange on the nose, followed by a full-bodied, spicy palate of cinnamon and stewed fruit.

NAME: Highland Park - Triskelion - Special Edition & Hip Flask
DESCRIPTION:
First-fill sherry-seasoned Spanish oak butts, first-fill sherry seasoned American oak casks and first-fill bourbon barrels and hogsheads were hand-selected and combined with a small number of refill casks to provide a degree of softness to the whisky’s final flavour.
Three legendary Highland Park Whisky Makers – Gordon Motion, Max McFarlane and John Ramsay – produced this expression to explore the influence of wood and cask seasoning on the flavour and character of our whisky.
This lot also includes a Highland Park hip flask.

NAME: Old Perth - 12 Year Old - 2004
DESCRIPTION: A 12 year old blended malt from Morrison & MacKay's Old Perth range.  This is one of 666 bottles produced.  This blend is a combination of malt whisky from Macallan and Highland Park, drawn from a single cask.

NAME: Ardbeg - Grooves (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt.  The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

NAME: Balvenie - 10 Year Old - Founders Reserve
DESCRIPTION:
This is a classic 10 year old created by The Balvenie Malt Master, David Stewart, from malt matured in bourbon cask and sherry butts.  It was a cornerstone of The Balvenie range since the early 1980s, but the Founder’s Reserve has now been discontinued.
In 2000, The Balvenie Founder's Reserve 10 year old won the International Wine & Spirit Competition Trophy for Best Single Malt under 12 years old.

NAME: Highland Park - 14 Year Old Single Cask #3376 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An Orkney favourite in this Highland Park single cask which has been matured for 14 years in Refill Butt #3376.
582 bottles were produced from this cask at the natural cask strength of 57.8%.

NAME: Clynelish - 1992 Distillers Edition 2007
DESCRIPTION:
This 1992 vintage Clynelish single malt double matured in Oloroso Seco cask wood casks. Bottled in 2007 at 46% by Diageo for their Distillers Edition series.  This is an early bottling in the series, a very collectable bottling.
Special Release: Cl-BR:170-2g

NAME: Port Charlotte - 10 Year Old - 2004 Cask Exploration #05
DESCRIPTION: A Port Charlotte 2004 vintage matured for 10 years in Oloroso Sherry cask #1064. Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 05 Bogha-Drochaide. One of 680 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.

NAME: Queen Elizabeth - De Luxe Scotch Whisky
DESCRIPTION: Queen Elizabeth De Luxe Highland Scotch Whisky bottled circa 1980 by Averys of Bristol. This is a 75cl bottling, bottled at 70 Proof.

NAME: Highland Park - That Boutique-y Whisky Company Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
A specialist in limited edition and small-batch single malt whiskies, single grains and bourbons. They have been winning awards for quite some time now for great expression and have gathered quite the cult following. They are very recognisable by the label on each bottle being in a graphic novel style drawing. Each label has a great connection with the whiskies that bottle encases. 
This particular bottling is the first release from Highland Park and is one of only 241 bottles produced @ 44.7% ABV. 
Bottle 122.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 10 Year Old - Valinch 'University of St Andrews'
DESCRIPTION: A 10-year-old Bruichladdich bottled for St Andrews University at 46%.

NAME: Glenlossie - 12 Year Old - Manager's Dram (2004)
DESCRIPTION:
A rare Glenlossie 12 Year Old bottled November 2004 at 55.5% volume.
The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo. These whiskies were selected by the respective distillery managers within Diageo malt distilling and bottled at natural cask strength.
Bottle 1443.

NAME: Wolfburn - Japan Exclusive - 1st Release
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling is the Wolfburn distilleries 1st release for the Japanese market.
Wolfburn Distillery is located in Thurso, making it the Northern most distillery on the UK mainland. Based around a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn reopened in 2013.

NAME: Bruichladdich -  #Laddie MP4 Tasting Set - 3x 20cl
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 3 x 20cl single cask bottlings.  This is one of only 860 sets of this release produced.

NAME: Ardbeg - Kelpie - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition bottling was produced to celebrate Ardbeg Day at the 2017 Fèis Ìle.
This single malt from Islay is the distillery's first to use virgin oak from the Black Sea coast for maturation.  Therefore it imparts deep flavour notes that only a very small amount of whiskies have ever before.  It was then married in ex-Bourbon casks.  This dram is packed with the seaside flavours of Ardbeg and peat smoke.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas Madeira Cask - (2016)
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This bottling was originally aged in ex-bourbon barrels before being re-casked in Madeira seasoned traditional hogsheads. It was bottled at 51.6% ABV.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas Madeira Cask - (2016)
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This bottling was originally aged in ex-bourbon barrels before being re-casked in Madeira seasoned traditional hogsheads. It was bottled at 51.6% ABV.

NAME: Longmorn - 13 Year Old - Single Cask Edition - Distillery Reserve Collection
DESCRIPTION:
This Longmorn 13 Year Old single malt was released as part of the Distillery Reserve Collection. These single cask bottlings were exclusively available at Chivas Brothers distilleries.
Distilled on the 17th of March 2005, it was bottled at cask strength from a single first-fill sherry cask, #21952, on the 1st August 2018.  This is one of just 924 individually numbered bottles produced.  This is a 50cl bottling.

NAME: Balvenie - 15 Year Old - 2000 Single Barrel
DESCRIPTION:
An edition of Balvenie's classic single barrel series, a 15-year-old single malt, drawn from a single traditional oak whisky cask and bottled by hand. 50.4%.
 
The label has faded/poor condition - meaning bottling date, in cask date, cask number and bottle number are not available.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old (Old Style)
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.5
DESCRIPTION: The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 15 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 15 year old single malt from Glenmorangie has sadly been discontinued despite being described by top critic Serge Valentin as being "very, very good."

NAME: Bruichladdich - 3D3 - Norrie Campbell Tribute
DESCRIPTION: 3D3 was produced as a tribute to the well-loved Islay peat-cutter Norrie Campbell, who passed away in 2006. 3D3 contains three malts; Bruichladdich, Port Charlotte and Octomore, at three different ages from 3 different warehouses. This is the most heavily-peated of the 3D releases.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 2006 11 Year Old - Micro Provenance #14006-14
DESCRIPTION:
Bruichladdich's unique Micro-Provenance series is as a series of single cask bottlings, released exclusively online.
This 11 year old is a limited edition of just 306 individually bottles. It was matured in a Burgundy cask that was filled on 6th November 2006 and bottled on 15th October 2018 from casks #14006-14 that used optic barley.
This is bottle number 201.

NAME: Ben Nevis - 10 Year Old 2008 Cask Strength Batch #1
DESCRIPTION:
A great distillery in one of the most beautiful parts of Scotland, Ben Nevis was built by "Long" John MacDonald in 1825.
This bottling is the start of a limited release series and was distilled on 21st April 2008. Matured for 10 years this dram has been aged in a combination of Bourbon, Sherry and Wine casks.

NAME: Scapa - 12 Year Old 2003 - Cask Strength Edition 9-12 & 14-16.
DESCRIPTION: This cask strength edition from Scapa distillery was distilled on the 10th of June 2003.  This dram was bottled from casks 9-12 & 14-16.  This is one of only 2148 bottles, which were only originally available to purchase from the distillery.

NAME: Highland Park - Hillhead (Keystone Series, Part 5)
DESCRIPTION: 'Hillhead' bottled at 46% ABV, marries both flavour and strength and was matured in three casks: European Oak Sherry, American Oak Sherry and American Oak Bourbon.  Hillhead was the last in a series of five special editions, showcasing Highland Park's five keystones of production.

NAME: Tomatin - 10 Year Old (1980s)
DESCRIPTION: An old bottle of Tomatin 10 Year Old from the 1980s.  This is a 75cl bottling with the old-style label.

NAME: Deanston - 8 Year Old 1980s​
DESCRIPTION: Deanston first opened in 1965 but it went under the name Old Bannockburn. This bottling is rare to come by because its from the 1980s which is before the distillery was taken over by Burn Stewart.

NAME: Clynelish - 10 Year old 2008 Artist Collective LMDW
DESCRIPTION:
This special bottling was designed by artist Serge Le Fox and was distilled back in 2008. It was matured for 10 years in 9 refill bourbon barrels.
Clynelish has seen a resurgence in the last few years with the announcement of the reopening of Brora distillery on the horizon.
Comes with 2 branded glasses.

NAME: Knockando - 1972 - 1983 Justerini & Brooks Ltd 75cl
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in 1972, this Knockando single malt was bottled in 1983 by Justerini & Brooks at 40%.

NAME: Glenordie - 12 Year Old (1980s)
DESCRIPTION: A  75cl bottling of 12-year-old single malt from Glen Ord, bottled by then distillery owner Dewars.  Released under the Glenordie name in the 1980s.

NAME: Port Dundas - 28 Year Old 1988 - Old Particular - The Crackerjack
DESCRIPTION: Only 290 bottles of this 1998 vintage Port Dundas were charged from a single Hogshead DL11693 by Douglas Laing, for their Old Particular Range. This bottling from the closed grain distillery is know as the 'The Crackerjack'.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #2115 - Highland Park Appreciation Society
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Highland Park Appreciation Society.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill butt #2115 at the cask strength of 59.1% ABV.  With only 576 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old #2103 Whisky Brother
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Whisky Brother.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in a refill Butt #2013 at a cask strength of 60.4%% ABV.  With only 552 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.
This is a 75cl bottling.

NAME: Glengoyne - 10 Year Old 1980s
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled, bottled and matured by the Laing brothers who owned the distillery at the time. 
Ian Maclouds introduction in 2003 has given the distillery a new lease of life.

NAME: Wolfburn - Christmas 2018
DESCRIPTION:
Located in Thurso, this is the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland. Named after a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn opened in 2013. 
This is the 2018 Christmas release and bears the verse of "Winter Time" by Robert Louis Stevenson on the label.

NAME: Glenallachie - 12 Year Old 1970s
DESCRIPTION: Some may not recognise this Glenallchie single malt in its older style packaging. It was distilled in 1970s and matured for 12 years.

NAME: Glenfarclas - 8 Year Old (1980s)
DESCRIPTION: Glenfarclas 8 year old single malt whisky from the 1980s. From the heart of Speyside, this little tipple is a great talking point. 75cl bottling.

NAME: Port Charlotte - 12 Year Old - 2004 Cask Exploration Valinch #13
DESCRIPTION:
A Port Charlotte 2004 vintage matured for 12 years in Bourbon/Monbazillac cask #12/202-27.  Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 21 Smachd Air Caileachd. One of 438 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 095.

NAME: Glenlossie - 12 Year Old - Manager's Dram (2004)
DESCRIPTION:
A rare Glenlossie 12 Year Old bottled November 2004 at 55.5% volume.
The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo. These whiskies were selected by the respective distillery managers within Diageo malt distilling and bottled at natural cask strength.
This is bottle number 0427.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.5
DESCRIPTION: The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

NAME: Port Charlotte - 10 Year Old - 2005 Cask Exploration #06 - Cuan-Ard
DESCRIPTION: A Port Charlotte 2005 vintage matured for 10 years in Grenache Blanc cask #1615.  Part of the Cask Exploration range, this is edition 06  Cuan-Ard. One of 432 individually numbered bottles, this is a limited edition from Bruichladdich Distillery. This is a 50cl bottling.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas Port & Wine Casks Feis Ile 2020 + Glass
DESCRIPTION:
Ahead of the rest in many ways, this distillery has been planning for the future since the 1920's when it was bottling its single malt. Along that southern coast of Islay are the 3 big hitters, Ardbeg, Lagavulin and of course Laphroaig. What many fail to realise is that Laphroaig is one of the largest if not the largest producer of whisky on the island. They also were one of the first-ever distilleries to hire a female distillery manager.
Friendship" in Gaelic is Cairdeas and this is the 2020 Feis Ile release. It has been matured in a both second fill ruby port casks and ex-bourbon casks before eventually being transferred into in ex-red wine barrels for the finish.

NAME: Glenglassaugh - 1986 - 2007 MacPhail's Collection
DESCRIPTION: This Glenglassaugh 1986 was specially selected and bottled in 2006 by Gordon & MacPhail for their Macphail's Choice range.  1986 was the year that Glenglassaugh distillery was closed before it was again reopened in 2005.

NAME: Glenrothes - 1989 (Bottled in 2001)
DESCRIPTION: A vintage expression from Glenrothes, distilled in 1989 and bottled in 2001. A hugely popular bottle - all over the world, from this Speyside distillery.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 12 Year Old - Golden Rum Cask
DESCRIPTION: Glenmorangie 12 Year Old, Golden Rum Cask has been aged in Oak Barrels for 12 years including a secondary period of maturation in casks that previously held golden rum from the Caribbean.

NAME: Glenrothes - 1987 Bottled 1999
DESCRIPTION: A 1987 vintage The Glenrothes, bottled in 1999 by the brand's owners Berry Brothers & Rudd.

NAME: Glen Spey - 12 Year Old - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 year old Glen Spey is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases.  The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo.  Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.5%.
This is bottle number 1228.

NAME: Glen Grant - 18 Year Old  - Rare Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Double distilled in tall slender pot stills.
This bottling of 18-year-old Glen Grant was released in 2016 and has since been Jim Murray's Scotch Whisky of the Year for 2017, 2019 and 2020.

NAME: Highland Park - RNLI Stromness Lifeboat
DESCRIPTION:
This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.

NAME: Highland Park - RNLI Stromness Lifeboat
DESCRIPTION:
This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
